intro: Limnobium spongia, commonly known as the sponge sponge or the floating sponge. It is a species of aquatic plant that belongs to the family Hydrocharitaceae. This plant is characterized by its spongy, leaf-like structures that float on the surface of freshwater bodies. It thrives in slow-moving or still waters, often found in ponds, lakes, and wetlands. Limnobium spongia plays a role in water filtration and provides habitat for small aquatic organisms.
